FAQ
You have questions,we have answers.



How secure is cryptocurrencies?

Cryptocurrency's level of security is similar to email, long passwords and 2fa help protect your wallets. Backing up your offline wallet is also strongly advised.

Is it commonly used?

Bitcoin has gained a wide variety of merchants worldwide, many major cities have businesses that accept BTC. Glasgow has a few, such as Brooklyn café, Shish Mahal and CEX which also has a Bitcoin ATM

How would I create a cryptocurrency?

You would need to have a lot of programming skills and a good understanding of crypto currency markets.

Can the Blockchain be seen by anyone?

Yes the Blockchain is an online distributed ledger, an online receipt that displays every transaction ever made.

Will bitcoin ever be worthless?

Possibly, it’s still an experimental currency and less than 10 years old. It is highly recommended not to invest more than you can afford to lose.

Why are there so many coins popping up every week?

As time passes more users are gaining the skills required to create their own cryptocurrency, many are innovative some are scams but all are extremely volatile.

What is the future of crypto-currency?

Many think crypto has a very positive future as its still early days and very recently crypto 2.0 arrived called Ethereum.

Will cryptocurrency ever be accepted as legal tender by the governments?

Every day more and more governments are taking notice of cryptocurrency  and they have started to seriously discuss the possibilities that comes with cryptocurrencies, but no one knows what will happen.
